Name: Spinach Pasta
Blurb: This dish is great for kids and healthy to boot..

Name: Slow Cooked Lamb Shanks
Blurb: The shank of the lamb is a great cut of meat. When slowly cooked over several hours, it releases some really great flavors which combines with the melted fat to provide a rich, succulent taste.

Name: Pumpkin Rissotto
Blurb: Creamy, delicious and healthy. One serve will not be enough.

Name: Mussels in White Wine
Blurb: Not that you would need much of a reason to eat mussels, but read on below for the amazing health benefits to eating this great tasting shellfish.

Name: Kokonda - Fijian Raw Fish
Blurb: Fish Kokoda (pronounced Koko-n-da) is a Fijian dish made by marinating fish in coconut milk. The taste can be described as close to sashimi, only much tastier!

Name: Spinach Sphaghetti
Blurb: This is a simple healthy dish which is made even better if you use fresh organic spinach.

Name: Chili Crab
Blurb: This dish is known as Chili Crab or Singapore crab and is one of the best tasting dishes you could ever make. It is a definite crowd pleaser and deceptively easy to make.

Name: Chinese Spicy Lobster
Blurb: I hate to see a good lobster cooked without flair. If you are tired of the plain old boiled lobster, then try this zesty Chinese recipe.

Name: Oyster-Soy Chicken
Blurb: This recipe was inspired by a Chinese Fijian who had a little cafe near the seaside city of Suva in Fiji. I started exploring Chinese dishes after trying out his food in my teenage years.
